title: 5 best female athletes in Africa based on 2023 results
body_text:
Sponsored Post
March 7, 2024 by Our Reporter
5 best female athletes in Africa based on 2023 results
Sport has long ceased to be an activity of interest mainly to men. Women watch broadcasts, follow athletes on social networks, and actively bet on their favorite athletes. In the latter, they are helped by best sports betting site 1xBet, and in the line of this brand, there are many women’s tournaments.
We present the top 5 main sports heroines in Africa based on the 2023 results selected by our site experts.
Faith Kipyegon
The legendary Kenyan runner won the 2016 and 2020 Olympics and became world champion four times. Her last performance in Budapest last summer was especially memorable because to her victory at the crowning distance of 1500 meters, she unexpectedly added gold in the 5000 meters. The 1xBet odds for this event were quite high, and many Faith fans made good money by betting on her victory. If successful at the Paris Olympics, Kipyegon can claim the title of the best female African athlete in history.
Read Also: Nollywood stars who died in first quarter of 2024
Gudaf Tsegay
The Ethiopian runner has many favorite distances, but lately, she has been particularly good at the 10,000 meters: in the main race of 2023, Gudaf confidently defeated her rivals and won the gold medal in Budapest. At the same time, the ambitious athlete is happy to challenge the favorites in the 1500 and 5000 meters, so we can expect her to duel with Kipyegon at the main competitions. Which of the two brightest athletics stars would you bet on?
Asisat Oshoala
The Nigerian football player was recognized as the best in Africa 6 times and is one of the main stars of world women’s football. Since 2019, Asisat has played for FC Barcelona, with whom they have twice won the UEFA Women’s Champions League. As part of the Catalan giants, Oshoala has already scored a crazy 92 goals in 108 matches. By the way, the bookmaker company 1xBet is a
reliable betting partner of the Barça women’s team and regularly organizes profitable collaborative promotions for sports betting fans.
Tatjana Schoenmaker
The famous swimmer from South Africa won the 200-meter breaststroke at the Tokyo Olympics. A year later, she set a new world record, and in 2023, she became the world champion in the distance. Tatjana is determined to compete for victory at the Paris Olympics, where she will challenge strong American athletes in two sprint distances.
Ons Jabeur
The athlete from Tunisia became the 6th woman tennis player in the world at the end of 2023, having won victories in the WTA 500 and WTA 250 series tournaments. She announced herself in 2022 when she made it to the finals of two Grand Slam tournaments (Wimbledon and US Open), and last year she repeated the success in England. Unfortunately, a big victory has eluded Jabeur for now, but her stability and focus on results will definitely bear fruit in the future.
